008 *******************************************************************************/
009package BinaryRegions;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012import static java.lang.Math.sqrt;
013
014import java.awt.Color;
015import java.util.List;
016
017import ij.IJ;
018import ij.ImagePlus;
019import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
020import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
021import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
022import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
023import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
024import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
025import imagingbook.common.regions.BinaryRegion;
026import imagingbook.common.regions.segment.RegionContourSegmentation;
027
028/**
029 * Shows each region's major axis as a vector scaled by the region's eccentricity.
030 * Also demonstrates the use of the region property scheme, i.e., how
031 * to assign numeric properties to regions and retrieve them afterwards.
032 * Requires a binary (segmented) image.
033 * 
034 * @author W. Burger
035 * @version 2020/12/17
036 */
037public class Major_Axis_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
038        
039        static double AxisLength = 50;
040        static Color CenterColor = Color.blue;
041        static Color MajorAxisColor = CenterColor;
042        static int LineWidth = 1;
043        
044        private ImagePlus im;
045        
046        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
047                this.im = im;
048                return DOES_8G + NO_CHANGES; 
049        }
050
051        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
052                
053                if (!IjUtils.isBinary(ip)) {
054                        IJ.showMessage("Plugin requires a binary image!");
055                        return;
056                }
057                
058                // perform region segmentation:
059                RegionContourSegmentation segmenter = new RegionContourSegmentation((ByteProcessor) ip);
060                List<BinaryRegion> regions = segmenter.getRegions(true);
061
062                // calculate and register certain region properties:
063                for (BinaryRegion r : regions) {
064                        calculateRegionProperties(r);
065                }
066                
067                // create the output (color) image:
068                ColorProcessor cp = ip.convertToColorProcessor();
069                cp.add(210);
070                
071                // draw major axis vectors (scaled by eccentricity): 
072                
073                for (BinaryRegion r : regions) {
074                        if (r.getSize() > 10) {
075                                Pnt2d xc = r.getCenter();
076                                int u0 = (int) Math.round(xc.getX());
077                                int v0 = (int) Math.round(xc.getY());
078                                
079                                double dx = r.getProperty("dx");
080                                double dy = r.getProperty("dy");
081                                int u1 = (int) Math.round(xc.getX() + AxisLength * dx);
082                                int v1 = (int) Math.round(xc.getY() + AxisLength * dy);
083                                
084                                drawCenter(cp,  u0,  v0);
085                                drawAxis(cp, u0, v0, u1, v1);
086                        }
087                }
088                
089                // display the output image
090                new ImagePlus(im.getShortTitle() + "-major-axis", cp).show();
091        }
092        
093        private void calculateRegionProperties(BinaryRegion r) {
094                // calculate central moment mu11, mu20, mu02:
095                Pnt2d xctr = r.getCenter();
096                double xc = xctr.getX();
097                double yc = xctr.getY();
098                double mu11 = 0;
099                double mu20 = 0;
100                double mu02 = 0;
101                for (Pnt2d p : r) {
102                        double dx = (p.getX() - xc);
103                        double dy = (p.getY() - yc);
104                        mu11 = mu11 + dx * dy;
105                        mu20 = mu20 + dx * dx;
106                        mu02 = mu02 + dy * dy;
107                }
108                
109                double A = 2 * mu11;
110                double B = mu20 - mu02;
111                
112                double normAB = Math.sqrt(sqr(A) + sqr(B));
113                double scale = sqrt(2 * (sqr(A) + sqr(B) + B * sqrt(sqr(A) + sqr(B))));
114                
115                double dx = B + normAB;
116                double dy = A;
117                
118                r.setProperty("dx", dx / scale);
119                r.setProperty("dy", dy / scale);
120                
121                // --------------------------------------------------
122                
123                // calculate 2 versions of eccentricity:
124                double a = mu20 + mu02;
125                double b = Math.sqrt(Math.pow(mu20 - mu02, 2) + 4 * mu11 * mu11);
126                r.setProperty("ecc1", (a + b) / (a - b));
127                r.setProperty("ecc2", (Math.pow(mu20 - mu02,  2) + 4 * mu11 * mu11) / Math.pow(mu20 + mu02, 2));
128        }
129        
130        private void drawCenter(ImageProcessor ip, int uc, int vc) {
131                ip.setColor(CenterColor);
132                ip.setLineWidth(LineWidth);
133                ip.drawRect(uc - 2, vc - 2, 5, 5);
134        }
135        
136        private void drawAxis(ImageProcessor ip, int u0, int v0, int u1, int v1) {
137                ip.setColor(MajorAxisColor);
138                ip.setLineWidth(LineWidth);
139                ip.drawLine(u0, v0, u1, v1);
140        }
141
142}
